and drinking    SUBOXONE is an opioid that blocks the effects of any other opioids  It's also sometimes prescribed for pain  I'm thinking if you have pain issues it may not be a good idea    Naltrexone is for addiction ss well but I take it to help with the night eating I get from my antidepressants     Xanax for anxiety is going to flatten your personality out and they also need to be increased constantly because its short acting  Maybe consider Klonopin which is better suited for someone who doesnt want to pop pills all day  I've had them all and stopped because they are the worst be even darker I know  Saying it feels like beating a dead horse but it's true  I'm a student physical therapist interested in working in a collaborative practice focused around the treatment of mental illness  I know several centers that employ a physical therapist to work with patients suffering from mental  not physical  ailments because it's so  so important    I have my own fair share of personal experience with mental illness and I accept that for me personally  I  have to  do some form of exercise every day  some days vigorous  some days active recovery  I  have to  eat well most of the time  This is on top of medication and vitamins  probiotics  fish oil  and rhodiola  It takes upkeep  But it beats being so depressed I let my life pass me by while I rot in despair and emptiness   A big tragedy and part of my life's work is that a lot of people have a very narrow concept of what they think "exercise" is  They think of the gym and they hate the gym  I hate the gym too  But I can run a marathon and move over 100lbs by myself  partly because physical therapy is a manual labor job   I love being outside in nature and so that is where I exercise in my spare time  Other people like being social and might enjoy something like swing dancing or rec league basketball  Others yet might be curious about yoga or pilates  Some don't have any interest in exercise whatsoever but can commit to walking 30 minutes a day if they think of it as part of their treatment  Movement is medicine  Some people like it  some people think of it as a necessary evil  but the key point is that it is in fact  necessary  for good mental and physical health  I am still learning how to best convey this to my patients but if they only listen to one thing I say  that's the most important take home message   We survived 2016  no problem surving 2017  I really hope so too  Hopefully being away from my family  who trigger my depression  will make things better  I feel like I probably won't even day  with a hole inside that can't seem to be filled  staring at a wall  trying to will yourself into doing  something   and then waiting for the day to end so you can rinse and repeat  It's not wanting to do anything  even with things that seem mundane like getting up to get something to eat or a cup of coffee  it's not enjoying things you used to enjoy  it's apathy and anhedonia   Be recommended can help a ton  That's just a very responsible doctor keeping tabs on your son since that is a very high dose  The standard "top" range is 30mg but it doesn't mean that you overdose at doses higher than that  I was on a dose higher than 30mg for a while  Even when I was at 15mg and 20mg my psychiatrist had me in for periodic EKG's just to check things out  Many psych medications can have cardiac implications  it's just kind of the risk many of them have  The class that abilify is in is known for having a small risk of an abnormal rhythm  an abnormal ECG  and sudden low blood pressure when standing up  Those symptoms are not generally super serious but it has caused the medical community to be considerably more cautious about other potential cardiovascular issues that could be present  especially in someone who may not be aware of any underlying issues    It sounds very much like your son's doctor is being responsible  There is no such thing as a "no risk" psych med  There is no "Tylenol" of the psych world  Some antidepressants are fairly benign and have few side effects and people can go about fairly normally with them  Any other class of med in the psychiatric world comes with risk and side effects that are somewhat unpleasant  Usually the illness they are treating is more unpleasant and so we take the meds  Abilify is honestly one of the more tolerable of the bunch  They sort of start getting less desirable from there   Yes I'm bored I have a headache Thank you  I appreciate the kind words That's me Snapchat is worse  Yet I still click through each and every story of people having a good time   OP you're probably a really chill person and I hope you have a better day tomorrow than you did tonight    If you're in upstate NY you can exercise  currently  only encompasses certain kinds of activities  or certain intensities  especially grueling workouts   you might think all exercise feels really bad  A lot of new exercisers jump in with good expectations but end up doing too much too soon  and it hurts  It's sweaty and uncomfortable and then you're sore the next day  Why does anyone like feeling like that    Because if you stick with it  and or  if you alter your definition of exercise to include lower intensity activities  https   www researchgate net publication 51513210 The Pleasure and Displeasure People Feel When they Exercise at Different Intensities Decennial Update and Progress towards a Tripartite Rationale for Exercise Intensity Prescription   it starts feeling good for almost everyone  Maybe not during the time you're exercising  but that's okay  Exercise in different forms is a pleasure for some people and a chore for others  But I firmly believe that  exercise is a necessary component of good mental and physical health     It saddens me that a lot of people don't exercise because they think exercise only means one thing  and they don't like that one thing  usually that thing is the gym   I always tell my patients to pick a lower intensity activity if they are having trouble with exercise adherence  If running means pain and sweat and breathlessness to you  why not try walking instead  If lifting weights is not your cup of tea  could you commit to home bodyweight exercises  Or home yoga videos  Do you enjoy a hobby that you might not have previously considered to be exercise  like gardening  The light exercise you will do is always better than the vigorous exercise you won't    I would really encourage you to try making a habit of any kind of daily activity that seems doable to you  It can sound daunting  but it doesn't have to be   somehow I am unsure if I keep going because I'm stupid   But I never wanna be skilled  I just wanna sleep  That's bad  Ignore them My year was friends were busy  And stupid me  I would always oblige thinking that maybe one day he would actually enjoy my company again  I started to think that he never actually wanted me around even when we were younger  Just the thought that someone could just dump a friend off like that after 6 7 years like nothing infuriated me  and killed me  The possibility that I was just "filler" that whole time was absolutely heartbreaking to me  From then on  I tried to fit in the best I could with whoever I could  Even if we had nothing in common I  just wanted people to appreciate me  for real this time  So I started to try to be the best at everything  If someone liked sports  I had to be the best at that so they might accept me  did they appreciate someone with good grades  Had to be the best at that too  I started to hang around with people I didn't even like just to be accepted  constantly worrying that they would just leave me in the blink of an eye  Through the years I found some friends that I actually liked to be around and felt  reasonably  comfortable with  But they always moved away   It had started my obsession with being someone I wasn't  It was who I was now  I can't even remember how it felt to be me  My thoughts are always scattered and fragmented and there are times when I literally can't form thoughts that even make sense to me  Trying to speak to people is difficult because I have no idea what to say or even how to say it because I'm trying to think of what they want to hear rather than what I would say  I am so distracted with trying to fit in  I literally don't know what kind of person I am  Am I nice  Am I loud  Am I annoying  Am I thoughtful   All of the shit I've had thrown at me used to make me sad and lonely and that became a normal feeling  Recently  it's been either I feel nothing or I feel hatred towards anything  everything  Hatred  thinking that I deserve all of this  but why  What the actual fuck did I do to feel like this   Most of my hatred however is directed at god  if there is one   My mom is religious and so took me to church when I was younger  Didn't think to much on the concept of god mostly because the people attending that church were all cunts so I just assumed that all Christians were that way  Later though about half way through high school  I thought I found my "salvation" so to speak  I had found people that I really enjoyed being around  still nervous around though   It was a youth group organized through two churches  one nearby and one out of town  It was a small group of people who I could have thoughtful conversations with  It was the only thing really worth living for  I thought to myself  "If this is what being a christian is all about  count me in " I would pray to god go to church  the works  After a few months  however  most of the people there had graduated and moved off to University or College and the majority of the group was replaced with a bunch of loud  annoying 10 14 year olds  I was utterly destroyed yet again  It was all back to normal now  I started to blame god for everything  started to build up all of my hatred towards everything  I've built up so much hatred for god and life that I get so unbelievably angry at everything that annoys me  Now the only thing that makes me even remotely happy is the escape that games provide  It's not enough but it's something   Every time something goes wrong in game  aside from if an enemy kills me or something  I get infuriated  For example if my internet is suddenly slow and I can't play a game that requires internet connection or if my game crashes I get so angry it's ridiculous sometimes leading to fits of rage telling god to die  I think the reason is that  I feel as though god has taken so much from fuck until you forget the whole thing  But you probably shouldn't listen to that  Work on your confidence bud  things'll get better  Hope it gets better  So I've spent a lot of time reading and thinking about this subject and over the last year or two my mood has improved significantly  I'd consider myself happy maybe 70 80  of the time   First you need to understand what makes you unhappy and generally  unhappiness comes from three sources    The first way is that your brain just isn't producing or maintaining enough of the chemicals that make you happy  This is persistent unhappiness and is due to a systematic problem that needs to be fixed  We usually just label it depression  but there are a myriad of things that can cause this  Drug and alcohol abuse are common ways to screw up your brain  When you exercise or have sex  your body endogenously produces some feel good chemicals  The system that regulates this has evolved for thousands and thousands of years and will not overdose your brain on these feel good chemicals  When you're pouring in chemicals from an external source  there is basically no way to regulate the dosage so it is very easy to go above whatever limit would be considered safe  Having persistent sleep issues that have no apparent source or feeling anxious or sad ALL the time  then you should visit a doctor as that may be the only way to fix this type of problem    The second source of unhappiness can be equally persistent but is due to a problem with perception  A common example is being unhappy with your appearance  To be unhappy about how you look  you have to first put a high value on physical appearance  have some pre existing ideal of beauty and be rating yourself as uglier than your ideal  It is a good thing to care about how we look since we use looks to quickly judge people we don't know  But how much do YOU actually value looks when it comes to the people you spend your time with and care about  It is probably not at the top of your list  There is no reason to think it would be at the top of everyone else's  so perhaps you are overvaluing the importance of how you look  Additionally  your ideal version of beauty is completely subjective  You may look fine to others and this is the goal of putting time in to your appearance  so there is no problem here   The last thing that can lead to unhappiness is inaction  If you're in a bad relationship and it is causing you misery  the problem isn't going to fix itself  You gotta get out of there  Similarly  if you're single and in a rut  sittting around at home isn't going to fix your problem  Go out and meet some people  If you're upset with yourself for not eating healthy  change up your habits    In general when trying to diagnose some source of unhappiness  always analyze your situation objectively and ask yourself why you feel a certain way  Don't stop at "I feel ugly" or "I feel lonely"  Ask yourself why you feel ugly or lonely and keep going until you have a plan in place to fix your problems  If there is nothing you can do  you need to adjust your expectations to meet reality  this usually happens naturally over time  but actively accepting your situation can help speed up the process   Therapy helps here  If there is something you can do  make a plan and do it  Don't think about it  Everyone has different personalities when they're with friends than when they're alone or at home  so try not to overthink or worry too much until your appointment  Explain to your doctor and I'm sure they can help you more     Good luck  I practice mostly Vipassana but I try to do some Metta  I have a hard time forgiving myself so doing Metta is a challenge for me  If this was a job  I would blackmail the boss  it's painful when you can't rely on emotional support from your parents  i try not to bring any emotional matters to my folks because they're clueless  and i end up feeling worse when i tell them about something that's tearing me apart and they respond with the  weather report   i'm fortunate to have a few friends i can talk to when i'm in pain    You don't need to know what is wrong with you to seek help  Depression isn't necessarily every single day being awful  It can be being fine some days and then awful other days  If you're at the point where you're tired of feeling terrible and you've been feeling like a burden then yes  there are definitely professionals that help with that kind of thing  Mental problems are an enormous spectrum and incredibly common in the mild forms  There is no need to be a certain level of bad before you seek help  Happy New Year to you too  I just wanted to write this somewhere and I'm not sure where to write it  2016 has been one of the hardest years of my life  I got kicked out of ROTC for a medical reason  I failed an entire semester of classes and dropped out of college  I feel like I am a complete failure  I had surgery for my legs in march and nothing has really changed being happy  My mom and dad got divorced when I was 10 and my dad got emergency custody of my siblings and I in 7th grade  I started drinking water instead of my regular 4 or 5 pops a day  I started watching how many calories I took in and started working out  I studied harder in school and started getting better grades  When I was living with my mother  I loved to figure out how things worked  I and 8th grade  I learned how to live cheaply  Buying nice clothes at yard sales for a couple dollars  My father and I would stay up until 12 or even 1 building end caps out of fiberglass for a trailer company that he worked for  We worked our asses off and we started to build something for ourselves  My dad like to fix wrecked vehicles and he traded many things for tools and equipment  Today we have our own body shop and we have cars lined up waiting to be fixed and sold right now  The only thing that I know to tell you is that you must find at least one thing in your life that you love and can't begin to tell you how many times I wanted to just lay in bed all day and just be lazy  but I let the things that I love be my motivation  No one can do it for you  I know that things are going consider myself attractive and witty  I love my personality  I love myself  But do I    2017 has begun  I have now lost two SOs from an opiate addiction  I have lost my best friend from alcoholism  I photographer  cinematographer  always had an eye for art and design  I don't care about any of that anymore    I wake up every day at 1pm  exhausted by 6pm  can't sleep until 4am  Wake up multiple times throughout the night  If I don't smoke I'm plagued by nightmares  Just last night I watched my parents die in my dreams  If I do smoke  I'm numb to the world around me  and my grades begin to drop    When I am alone  the isolation cripples me  I'm left to my own anxious thoughts  worrying over things I can't tell if they're serious or not  If I should be worrying or if it's just anxiety  I Hi  I'm new on this subreddit and yours is one of the first I've read  I have to say  if your therapist doesn't take you seriously  find another  An aspect of depression is that little things have a huge affect  I've been dealing with depression now for several decades  on and off  and have been on sick leave since last May because of depression and anxiety  What you're describing are pretty typical indications  especially the losing interest in hobbies and such   My therapist tells me that I need to do those things regardless of whether I "want to" or not  doing them will slowly rekindle the interest and the joy that they bring  Hang in there  And find a therapist that takes you seriously  I tried scripting to see if I could figure out how scripters think and see if I could learn how to beat them  It made the game a lot less stressful when all you do is press spacebar or c and v  You lose sense of the toxicity in the game  but it  also killed my dream of playing League competitively  I realized how dreadful of a player I was without scripts so I quit  At least you can still cry  I've been alone for so long I'm longing for it    not the loneliness tho  Paradox I know  That's awesome man  That and a daily shower help so much  Invest time in yourself  You're worth it  it's an on and off type of thing  sometimes i dont do it becasuse i feel like i dont deserve it Masturbate  PRN meds and a whole heap of distractions  Touch your dog and you're toast you little shit They will understand when they're older  I think this sub skews more towards the teenage end of the spectrum  I don't even know why I sub here as a mid 30's guy  I have nothing in common with people here  Really  it often makes me feel more alone because I can't give a shit about video games 99  of the time  I've been thinking a lot about loneliness for a while now  I think I worded quite well in a recent comment too      One thing I believe we all have in common is a sense of aloneness  Whether this manifests itself as loneliness in everyone  I'm not sure  But the way we see and deal with ourselves is different to the way we see and deal with others  and the way we see other people see and deal with each other    I experience the world only through my own eyes  I can only think with my own mind  When I pee  or get out of bed  it's only me doing it  Nobody else  Feeling sore or tired is only done myself  I can't feel your pain    When I talk to someone it is a fundamentally different experience than when I see someone talk to someone else  For example  I might talk to Steve and Paul  When I talk to Steve or Paul  it's me talking to the "other"  someone separate from myself  There is an element of aloneness present in that  I can't see what they thinking the way I can see what I am thinking    When I see Steve and Paul talking however  it's different  It's now two "others" talking  It's different from when I talk to Steve or Paul  It's more connected  It's more connected because they're the same in my experiences  they're both an outside entity  Something of which I cannot experience life through  This means I look at them as more connected together than I am with either of them    I'm more alone than the other people I meet  but they're more alone than me  We all share this common aloneness  this sense of loneliness  And we can experience it together    Coming together doesn't remove that feeling  Might make it easier to cope with  I'm not sure  This is just what I've been thinking about as I become less bitter and try to reach out to people more     I think it also causes a bit of a vicious cycle  When you feel lonely you want a connection with other people  So it makes sense that the "cure" to your loneliness is company  But company doesn't change that fundamental aloneness  In fact  in my experience  group company can make it worse  By directly seeing Steve and Paul talking  you experience that sense of difference and enhanced aloneness    Company then enhances your loneliness instead of helping it  So now  feeling even more lonely you start to think something is wrong with you  Other people have such strong connections with each other  it's different to how you connect with people  "What's wrong with me " you start to think  "Why can't I get close to people "  And it's not like they don't like you  nor you them  You just don't feel close to them  There's a distance    The way I then see it  the answer to dealing with loneliness is understanding that fundamental aloneness and dealing with accepting that  How do you do that  Good question    I think it's easier to do sometimes than other time  We all have moments of weakness    Don't mean to too my own horn but I feel this understanding of loneliness has helped me immensely both in regards to myself and others  There's nothing wrong with the person surrounded by friends feeling lonely  nor is there anything wrong with the person almost entirely alone not feeling lonely  or vice versa    This just made my year Oh my gosh  I didn't even think the reason I "forget" to rush my teeth might be my depression  That or I just don't remember  An anti depressant combined with therapy works well  To assume that only one thing is a cure is a grey area in mental health   Happy New Year to you too  Rob  it's ok  I appreciate it anyway I guess at this point all we can really do is put our head down  charge forward and forget our feelings until it gets better  That seems like my number one option right now I wish I could cry it hurts so much having everything you need someone to talk to you can always hit me up as well  im on reddit quite a lot  I wrote a comment explaining my understanding of loneliness that I think might help you if you're interested in giving it a read  here  https   www reddit com r depression comments 5lb631 id rather be all alone than feel alone in crowd dbv5l4h      I can't tell you how to stop hating yourself  but I can tell you that I used to hate myself and was in a bad place in High School as well  After High School I gradually became less bitter  made jokes about how great I was    then the jokes gradually stopped being jokes  It seems for most people it gets better with age  It doesn't for everyone  but there's always hope there     I can't tell you how to deal with loneliness or depression  I can explain loneliness as I understand it and hope that helps  I can recommend therapy to deal with depression  Otherwise  again  those both often get better after High School  High School is a messy place full of teenagers with messy hormones  It can be hard     I can't tell you how to keep your friends either  But I can suggest you look up things like the book "How to Win Friends and Influence People"  or the youtube channel "Charisma on Command" and think about how you come across to others  The way we act  even subtly can affect how people perceive us  being aware of that and changing even minor things  Like saying 'I don't mind'  instead of 'I don't care'  can make drastic improvements on how you come across     One more thing  I started to feel much better when I stopped caring about being more invested in the friendship  relationship  whatevership  Oddly it made me both more and less invested  I invite people to do things  or start up conversations with people just because I want to  If they don't want to  I don't mind  I give friendship out as I want like a gift  not expecting anything in return  I think people often WANT to be a better friend  they WANT to be there for you  but they don't know how      You say you're fat too  I'd suggest you change that  Not even to stop people teasing you or anything  Fuck 'em  Plenty of fat people are incredibly popular  But you've stated that you hate yourself and have low self esteem  I believe losing weight will be a step in the right direction in that regard  Keep it simple  just replace soft drink with water  Or  if replacing it altogether is too much  just drink a glass of water before you have any soft drink and you'll drink much less  Gradually replace your bad dietary habits with good ones  By 2018 you won't even recognise yourself     You're young and you want to improve  you're gonna do fine  Same  She is completely dependent on me  She needs me for even the most basic of needs like water  If I killed myself somewhat unfortunate potential side effects  but they are potential ones  Meaning  not everyone gets them and it's highly dependent on the individual who takes it  Seven people could come on here and tell you their experience and all seven of those could be wildly different    Many people decide that the side effects  if any  are worth having their minds back once they experience that  It is a very effective medication  It is honestly known to be one of  if not  the most effective medications for the symptoms you are describing  The only reason it is not prescribed more often is an extremely rare blood disorder than can develop  It's almost unheard of it is so rare  It requires that  especially at the beginning  you go in for a weekly lab draw  The pharmacy will not be able to fill your prescription unless they have the results of that lab work  It's a highly regulated special registration system for that med that pharmacies have to go through  If you miss your lab work  you don't get your prescription  They cannot give it to you  There may be a one day exception or something but in general  that is regulated by the FDA  so I don't think they have much leeway  I have two pharmacists in my family who practiced for over 25 years and neither one of them ever saw anyone have signs of the blood issue ever  They don't know any pharmacists who have either  It's a very rare issue    The other thing to keep in mind  is like any med  if you take it and it becomes unbearable in terms of side effects  where they outweigh the benefit of the drug  you can talk to your doctor about changing  If the side effects cause you so much distress that your quality of life is crap  then clearly the drug isn't worth it  Your doctor should be able to see that and work with you while everything just keeps deteriorating  Career  Family  Health  and Life in general   You have to understand one thing  It's the perception of mind  the intent of actions  and performing the intended action that will slowly but steadily change your circumstance  Unless you understand this and apply it to every aspect of your life  nothing will change  Another thing I would add is that the change wont happen overnight  It will take months before you see the effects    What you need to do is install new habits  adapt new values  and ultimately change your mindset so that the actions that you take yield the desired results      Here's what helped me       Creating a routine ritual  This way you have something to look forward to through the day     Workout  Hit the gym  focus on form  repetition  and then the weights  Don't have money  look into calisthenics  All you will need is your body  ground  and a pull up bar   Elementary school playgrounds have them and are free to use after school hours   After a few weeks  you will notice that you're less aggressive  have a more defined self esteem  and will begin to value self discipline and persistence     Eat  Not eating doesn't do anyone any good  You will be bitchy through the day and people will reflect that bitchiness back at you  If you are working out  you will need your strength so eat a balanced diet     Breathing exercises  Not sure why  but they will make you more mindful  make your body more efficient  and increase concentration  I suggest the Wim Hoff method since it's free on youtube     Clean up  Shave  get a haircut  brush your teeth  take showers  wear clean clothes  etc  It's nice tell people to nor judge a book by it's cover  but let's face it  your presentation of yourself will dictate how many folks look at you  This will also help you get a job     Few other thoughts       Ask yourself what success means to you  And then make really small goals steps to accomplish it  If you just perform the above steps without a set goal  you will aimless proceed through life and you will not be in tune with the changes      Hug your dad  He is the only dad you will ever have in this world depending on your location  It isn't much but it will put food on the table for a day or two  Also  there are churches and soup kitchens that can help you out      Wake up every morning and look at remission after taking 2 3 grams per day  I have been taking two grams per day for about a month now  I am currently experimenting with dividing the two grams into two seperate doses and taking both grams at once  I have read some anecdotes that taking two grams at once works better  In any case  it will likely take a couple of weeks before you see any benefit   I have also been taking 4 5 mg of low dose Naltrexone per day  which I suspect is helping as well  Interestingly  both Naltrexone and Agmatine have tolerance reducing properties  I have no idea if these mechanisms directly play a role in their antidepressant effects or if other effects are at play  However  both substances seem to be sustainable treatments  as opposed to treatments that need to be cycled   which is probably the best characteristic for a compound intended to treat anhedonia   At times life is good  at times it feels like worth of giving up  Fixing those issues is like moving a mountain just to get to the alone  I think we  this sub  still mostly thinks of suicide as something bad  We don't want each other to kill oneself    But we won't shame or guilt a person about it   About describing it as a battle or a fight  I understand very much where that comes from  And I can follow the thought  Yet on the other hand psychologists have learned that it's not helpful to use martial language when it's about describing cancer  There is so much military language in use  "Fought the battle enemy"  "lost the the brave fight"  "a survivor"  "beat it"  Again  I understand where it comes from  But often it's not helpful  If cancer comes back it's not the fault of an ill person who's not trying hard enough  There is no "losing the fight"    Some links    https   www theguardian com society 2014 apr 25 having cancer not fight or battle   http   www cancer net blog 2015 05 choosing your words wisely imagery metaphors and cancer   http   www nytimes com 2011 08 28 opinion sunday cancer fighting words html   http   www practicalradonc org article S1879 8500 16 30091 1 abstract cc y  Initially  I experienced delayed sleep and temperature changes  When I upped my dosage to 4 5 mg  I experienced worsening of one of my IBS symptoms  but that has subsided  My doctor predicted that would happen  LDN is actually phenomenal for IBS       I am currently two months in and one side effect that has remained is vivid dreams  They're the type of dreams that you wake up and question whether or not the dream was real  My sleep has definitely improved though    Lastly  my appetite has been consistently reduced  almost to the same extent as Adderall  Managing that side effect takes planning   So the side effects are bearable  One thing to look out for is rashes  I've heard scattered anecdotes of facial rashes  but I haven't experienced it   The number is different but the shit is the same I don't want you to feel like you're not entitled to calling yourself depressed because you do in fact deserve to call your state of mind however you want  after all it's your mind  Depressed is just another label which I don't like   I can't comment on how my age has affecting anything  because I was just diagnosed   but I've had fairly a positive experience with Latuda  if that's what you're thinking of trying next   Doing okay  Christmas was a struggle   Ya  you become the witness of everything  Depressed people think a lot  it's one of the reasons why we suffer  Other people don't stop to analyze things  they are fine with whatever is in life for them and lucky for their happy genes  Can you get your doctor to write up a letter explaining your depression and that you are receiving treatment  That might help as it's coming from a medical professional   I have no advice on getting out of bed  sadly  Most of the reason I kept showing up for work the last few years was that calling off was harder for me than just picking my clothes off the floor and going in  I got so I could get ready half asleep and show up at work with no idea how I got there    But once I was there I worked hard to pass the time and take my mind off things  so I didn't seem lazy or depressed so much at work   My husband tried to help by making sure that I had food  tea  a lunch packed  etc  He did everything he could to make sure that I kept the job and I still barely made it  I still had  so many  lates last year that I almost got fired   I finally got sat down and asked directly about the lates and had to admit that I was depressed  That was about a month into a new medication  and expand on this a little because it's how I can articulate my own concerns   There are starving people all over the world  yet a lot of us can afford to eat lavishly  Should we feel guilt about that fact we've all probably said 'I'm starving' when there really are starving people in the world  No  because contextually we exist in totally different paradigms of hunger  You shouldn't be made to feel guilty because you live in an environment in which food is readily available  A moment can be spent thinking of those with issues  causes can be pursued  injustice felt  but guilt in this situation is baseless  I feel the same about depression  Someone may have lost limbs  parents  squirrel's  you never know  and that has driven them to deep depression  You just woke up and you're depressed  Again  contextually  what causes your depression is a totally seperate paradigm  Just because someone has been through 'real' trauma does not make them more entitled to being called depressed  Personally I know my depression started long before I had any real trauma in my life  and even after the many years of hell I put myself through I still don't feel like I'm worthy of being depressed  But I can't help the fact that I'm in pain all the time  I struggle with so very much  and I shouldn't need to feel guilty because I never lost an ear fighting the Spartans  I know I trivialise a little       Sorry  such a ramble  Basically  it's all about context  We feel things because of our context and we can't compare our feelings to someone that has lived in a totally further  This is going to be one very  very big bulk of text but please read from beginning to end   I'm 23 just like you  And 23 years ago  people found out from the get go that I was a bit    different  I didn't interact socially much  and kept to myself a lot  The diagnosis came pretty quickly  autism   Now  my family fortunately did a good job at handling it  So while my childhood wasn't perfect whose is   it was pretty damn nice  and slowly  bit by bit  I managed to get more social  So at the end of childhood I had a few friends  And a good piece of news came  for freshman middle school I would be put in the same class as two of my friends from elementary   And they started to bully me  Those two 'friends' of mine   So  this destroyed me mentally and emotionally  and since I was already disoriented all the time thanks to my autism  I closed myself up  I became frozen  And although I did get in another class the year after  I didn't dare opening up  In that same class I managed to do a bit better grade wise though  This made sure that I would be put in a higher level course next  The reason I was the most happy about this was because I could get into an environment without those bullies  So I tried opening up again   And I got bullied  Again   This made me 'reconfirm' the negative self image of myself  which was initially taught by two of my 'friends'  So all of my years of middle high school one thing in the Netherlands  were complete hell   To top that all of  I also got kicked out of college once  This happened because I had to do an internship  but the company I did my internship at wasn't suited for someone like me  who has a form of autism  Internship got terminated  I got a lesser quality  degree  and with no experience and it being the middle of the recession no one wanted to hire me  No one   Now  a few years later I'm studying physics  And I've finished an internship overseas  in the US  And I worked alongside an internationally  well known project within particle physics  I've also made a lot of good friends through the years  So all is going well    And I STILL wish that it was better    But you know what  That's natural  To want things to be better is only natural  Like you  I'm 23  and still don't have a relationship for example  That sucks  You see everyone already  having or having multiple relationships and you still don't  In my circle of friends there are only a few left with no relationship experience  Even though I'm one of the older ones     Still  in my opnion it's important to accept where you are  and not Slap me  I must be dreaming "  Sorry your mom didn't tell you  that's kinda shitty of her    How bipolar has affected me  I went from an ENTP who wanted to make a career mathematically modelling human behavior to an ENFP who wants to make a career helping people cope with their emotions as a therapist  I also decided to find out a lot about neuroscience and psychiatric drugs   I've learned what meds help most for what symptoms  what risks are safer to take and which to never take  I've learned it's important to talk about your feelings  but also that it's important for that that talking happen with people you trust  I've definitely come to appreciate the importance of taking care of myself better as I've aged  Idk  If you have more specific questions I'm happy to do my best to answer ever go through the motions and essentially fake it  So I'm there physically  but just as disconnected on an emotional level as I ever was   I've gotten my doctor to write a note to my college so my deliver them   If he brings up 'attitude' problems  tell him you were under stress and exhausted before Christmas  and that you're sorry if it appeared that you were having a bad attitude  People forget to mention mental disorders fall on a spectrum  If you're on the extreme end  regular meds are absolutely required  The brain is completely unable to reliably regulate its own activity  so it must rely on pills to do the job for it  Kind of similar to type 1 diabetes   So  do you need meds  You can't rely on others' opinions  You have to rely on your own personal evaluation of your situation  with the help of a good pdoc   Some people need pills 24 7  Others only need it during winter  and major life events  Others only need it during severe life changing events    I believe the more severe sufferers frequent this subreddit  since they need more group support  and therefore you will see a lot of "You have to take your meds every day "  Whether you need meds 24 7  or not  you need to find and keep a good pdoc     for regular checkups  and in case of emergencies   I can't stress the "good" part enough  There are an alarming number of bad pdocs  including the ones who don't care  and therefore fail you in your time of extreme need  Think of it like this  I hate myself when I do just anythung  The only thing I know how to do is absolutely nothing  When I wanted to hang myself because I didn't see the point in life  Still don't see a point  for many years i was denying to call my troubles depression because i believed it was a part of who i am  I thought it's part of my identity  to drown in swamps of gloom and anxiety  Besides after bad day next one was ok ish so  it's normal me not an illness  I was so afraid medication will alternate my personality  Currently i am also heavy medicated  but i understand now  that depression was the one alternating my personality  Drugs didn't made me fully normal but i am more myself than without them  Turns out controlling sadness every second and suppressing all emotions is not part of my nature  But i still feel guilty calling myself depressed  is it just bad stigma of mental illness and overusing depression to describe any crying spells in one  I feel guilty even to try to say I understand you or that I am in similar state  even if in my mind formulates the same sentences of confusion on who am I  Only with the effect depression has on partners or friends    I saved dozens of them because I identify that much with many of those  I went to bed at 1015 pm and it felt wonderful to wake up at a normal hour  fully rested and no hangover  I'd take that over most other ways last night could have gone  It depends on the province you're in  As I suspect each province is different  In B C  I had to get on wage assistance first to make it easier for the Disability to be approved   I was also told by everyone I saw  and recommend this myself  go to an advocacy group first  They will create a case file  Fill out the paperwork with you and write a letter to your doctor instructing him how to properly fill it out and phrase it in such a way that it's more "acceptable" to the government  In B c  not only did I need a doctor but I needed a secondary person as well  I used my psych as my secondary person and my family doctor as my main  Once all parts are filled in you need to mail it to the government  Depending on backlog waiting on status could be a while  I submitted mine end of August 2015 and was approved end of December 2015    If you are not approved at first  you can appeal the decision  This is where having a file with the advocacy group comes in handy  because they will help you with the appeal process  Whereas if you're on your own   then you've got to figure it out yourself    In B C  the Disability status is permanent  So long as you keep your papers  If you leave B c  then return after 10 years  if you resubmit your acceptance paper your disability will be reinstated    Once again though  I highly recommend you check out your local disability alliance  They will hold your hand through everything   I actually found some movies very helpful when at my due to experience in the field   I'm not sure about what comes first  but there's a couple of things you ideally could would do simultaneously  the times stated are for me  I'm BP1 and no one is an average case  YMMV      Accept what you have  and that it's for life  This took quite a while for me  I think about 2 years  It's not the same as  accepting I'm depressed right now but I'm going to get better and I will never  have to worry about it  It's a case of  I need to make some lifestyle choices that other people don't have to make  and I have to carefully monitor my moods and major life decisions  For life  Therapy helps a lot with this    Sort out your meds  That's both filling off the extreme edges of mood swings  crippling depression and mania   but also cutting down if you start becoming too flat too dumb  That process took me about 1 5 years  and I'm still tuning a bit    Start practicing self care and routines  This might sound stupid if you're not in a depression right now  but that means regular shower body hygiene  regular meals that are not entirely shit  some regular exercise  regular sleeping  regular regularity  Alcohol  caffeine  tobacco  in moderation  Some swear by abstinence  they might be right  And  above all   you probably know this   impeccable medication hygiene  Create a habit of taking your meds  always carry a days supply  etc    This paragraph was for me the really long and exhausting part  I'm never going to finish this  and I've already relapsed quite a bit from my good weeks    I barely involve any of my family or friends in my illness  But I have discovered a trick to getting people to see the severity of it  and give them space to ask questions  Drag them to your psychiatrist  Mine was open to the idea  and my siblings were a lot more receptive to a person with a degree nailed to the wall telling them I was seriously ill  then their little brother saying he was    I can imagine that having a loving and supporting fiance is a great help  You probably will have to learn to care for yourself  before you can teach others how to care for you  But I have also noticed my father  who I live with  is a good second opinion on my mood swings  and he has a better memory  so he's a good authority on how I've evolved over long periods   Sorry for the rambling  writing is how I order my broken mind    Good luck  Check out this ultimate combo brother  It comes with the acronym of "NEW START"  N  Nutrition  E  Exercise  W  Water  S  Sunlight  T  Temperance  A  Air  R  Rest  T  Trust  I didn't make this up  but I did learn it from a program that teaches it  and I have been really liking the results  and now I love my life again  Source   http   www newstart com newstart2   http   www newstart com newstart2   Yeah  that's you enjoy doing it  cheesy as that sounds  Well  there are some really common symptoms of depression to check for  For example  have you been sleeping okay  have you had changes in appetite  do you find it more difficult than usual to get out of bed  do you feel 'slowed down' or get aches and pains'  do you feel worse about yourself than usual  do you feel hopeless  or as if nothing will get better  is your focus concentration poorer than usual   If you have a number of these symptoms  it is likely you are experiencing depression  but I cannot diagnose you of course  and whether it is depressed and sometimes I still get down but I remember the things that I truly love to do and make me happy  I'm really shy and introverted but I like books  so I started going to small bookstores recipes that I think I may enjoy  Take the time to enjoy your own company  It doesn't make you a loser  it makes you smart  And once you truly get to know yourself  like I said  you start to attract people who like similar things  I met a really cool guy at a Chargers game who sat next to me and we are now bonding because he was doing something similar by going to the games alone too  He too  was feeling like a loser and lonely but after getting out  doing the things that he wanted to do  he  like myself  found people who were in similar situations    Often times we feel like nobody for short periods since I can't sleep in the day  I know have 2 dogs that keep me entertained a bit but usually only to a point when I long to do something with myself   For many it may be a lifesaver I am becoming less sentient  It's only when the eye fatigue kicks in and I am forced to stop using it due to the pain in my eyes  I then take a break but that only provides temporary relief as returning to my work or entertainment brings back the eye fatigue in minutes  A nights rest usually fixes it for a few hours  I have zero emotion left complete anhedonia and an very depressed  I am not suicidal though I don't see the point living like this either  During very bad spells I am unable to work and have to leave early or just stare all day at my screen  I fear I might lose my job as a result   The problem is that depression puts strain on the brain which is now very overworked from thinking  Bombarding it with flashing and changing TV content is allot for the brain to process not only while watching it but during your REM sleep and dreams as the brain tries to sort this backlog of information overload  That why depressed people sleep more and still feel tired all the time   The same applied to playing games  It's stressful on an overloaded overworked brain  And same for the internet  However the internet has other disadvantages  you can google your diseases sit on discussion forums or Reddit and get tons of misinformation or attempt to self diagnose which may make you worry more or increase emotion  I tend to google my meds and google alternatives to suggest and this has annoyed my psychiatrist as I come across as a know it all   But while the computer seems like a lifeboat since it's saving your life right now you cannot live in a lifeboat all your live  Eventually the lifeboat will sink as it is in my case  The solution is to make your rest of your life work  Since I have not been able to do that I can't advise on how  But people will generally recommend getting out more with friends and family  Exercising and getting out in nature  As well a following a healthy diet and addressing any shortcomings like Vit D or others and supplementing omega 3's  And getting a good nights sleep  Doing this as a depressed person seems like a mountain and it's hard or seemingly impossible to do all that at once   I was in a clinic once for 2 weeks where we were not allowed a computer or phone  We were giving access to the phone for one hour a day  There was a TV though I never watched it except for my last weekend  My eye fatigue significantly improved and I was forced to socialise and attend classes  Now it was probably a combination factor of the meds and the environment I was forced to make life changes including daily walks but at the but they drain a load of our energy  We have to direct our attention to so many different people we can't help but be exhausted  If you're extroverted that gives you a high  If you're introverted only water  Cut out all soda  juice  alcohol  coffee with cream and sugar  etc  I happen to like seltzer water a lot  It does 2 things for you  It drastically cuts down on a source of empty sugar calories and it keeps your palate clean of lingering flavors that tell you to go get another helping of whatever it was you were eating   Find a way to build exercise into your life 5 days a week  For that who get off of work at the end of the day and then their sole mission in life is just to run through their contact list one by one and figure out who is available to distract them that night  And I'm not assigning this behavior to them  they've flat out admitted they can't stand to be alone  Life would seem pretty exhausting if you constantly have to be in pursuit of some sort of distraction and live in fear that you're gonna find a gap in your calendar where you have to spend some time by yourself  And it's insulting being friends with that type of person when you know the invitation to hang out on certain days just means they got that far down in the contact list and decided to ask you    I guess it more so hinges on if it's just the fact that you're alone that brings about the depression  or if you're depressed or have other things on your mind that finally come out when you find yourself alone  If it's solely that the being alone itself is what rubs you the wrong way  that's not good  You should be able to enjoy some alone time  If it's that other fears and doubts creep out when there isn't something to distract your senses  then you have to try to figure out what than seeing this as his manipulative mother coming in and messing things up and tearing him away from you  you have to consider that if he gave up the fight that easily that he must not have been too concerned about having a real future with you or taking this relationship to the point of full commitment  I can tell you right now if I deeply loved someone  even my own family trying to come between us and manipulate me with some silly threats wouldn't be enough that suddenly I'm willing to distance myself from that person  So don't do him the favor of acting like he's an equal victim of circumstance here and that you've both had your future taken away because of her  He wouldn't be going along with her demands if he valued having a real future with you  In the end this gives you a clear window into how much he was concerned about you and having that future together  and it doesn't seem like much  No man who loves you could be taken away from you by his mother  That's his problem to live with and maybe some day in the future come to realize how foolish he was that he made that more important than you  But don't look at this like it's the circumstances keeping him from you  He's allowing himself to be kept from you    If you wanted more than some relationship that can never be anything official  then of course it is unhealthy to put aside what you know is right for you and try to go along with it  Of course this all depends on what is causing the problem in a relationship  if you were here saying you want a man who can provide you all the money and riches in the past new year's day before I ended up inpatient  but I'm pretty sure I spent valentines day in a psych hospital  I was in love at the time   Consider buying homeworkouts on DVD along with some adjustable dumbbells   The advantage of getting a DVD workout is that the onscreen instructor will tell you about good form   If what you want is strength training  since you mention bodybuilding  a few good DVD instruction workouts include  P90X or P90X3  these ones use a pull up bar in addition to dumbbells  Rushfit  martial arts combined with endurance strength training  Body Beast  more traditional bodybuilding I think  uses dumbbells and pull up bar and bench  And MOSSA  which is coming out on DVD soon   I know it because it used to be available on XBox  fun workouts for beginner or intermediate  some martial arts and some weights workouts   If you buy adjustable dumbbells  there are two types  standard size or Olympic size  It is important to make this decision first because the weight plates fit either one or the other size but not both  Olympic size has a higher weight limit and the handle is thicker  Find out highest limit  and decide based on that whether you will ever need Olympic or if standard is enough for you  If your long term goal is very heavy weight  then you could decide on Olympic from beginning   The plates can be reused for barbells in the future  but I read recommendation to start with dumbbells for 1 3 years before moving to barbell  Once you decide on size  you can buy a bunch of plates of different weights to gradually attach to your dumbbells    Start low weight  and increase very gradually  for example every 2 3 weeks increase by smallest possible amount     I recommend getting more than one set of handles for dumbbells so you can have two or three different sizes prepared for your workout and don't need to take time to switch plates during the workout  For some muscles you will be able to use heavier dumbbells than for others   An important thing to keep in mind  if you do strength training with weights  do not exercise same muscles two days in a row  Plan to let the muscle rest for 48 hours before working same muscle again  Either alternate lower body days and upper body days  or alternate strength and cardio workouts  Yes its sad realizing that time never stops  I know what you mean  Going through this right now  Based don't do that  have you tried other meds  I know cymbalata worked amazing for me  but my insurance no longer covers it for me unfortunately  Trintellix   Mirtazapine would be a good antidepressant combination to antagonise 5 HT receptors known to have antidepressant effect  5 HT2A 2C 3 7  and Alpha 2 adrenergic receptors   The only downside with Mirtazapine is that it's a potent H 1 antagonist which causes drowsiness and sedation  Some say it subsides over time while others say it never truly goes away  It's also a weak mAChRs antagonist  670nM   It's claimed to have negligible anticholinergic effects but I'm skeptical since Abilify's mAChRs antagonism is in the 1000's but it's still considered to have  ACB Scale of 1  http   www agingbraincare org uploads products ACB scale   legal size pdf   So although Mirtazapine hasn't been tested  it could potentially have ACB scale of 2 which is concerning   Another downside with Trintellix   Mirtazapine is that it's missing the NRI part  Unless if Mirtazapine's Alpha 2 adrenergic antagonism can make up for that   While Nortriptyline has a nice pharmacologic profile  I feel like its mAChRs antagonism  40nM  is too potent for me to want to try it    So I'm currently leaning towards Trintellix   Mirtazapine or Reboxetine  yeah I think so too  It's how my brain works  I'm not that worried that it's dangerous for me  It sort of bums me out though  I feel disappointed with myself  I haven't gotten to the point of deciding to get pregnant but have discussed it with my pdoc  hypothetically  and he said if I was to go that calls are people  and as with people in any profession  some  perhaps most  of them will not operate at the level they should be operating at   It's frustrating when the mental health system often only gets one or a few shots at offering help and giving you hope  and the person you interface with doesn't have the capacity to offer anything constructive and does more harm than good   Happened to me in a different setting  when I hit rock bottom and knew I needed help  I went to see a therapist and he spent an entire session making fun of me and cracking jokes about my situation  It was gut wrenching  I still feel sick thinking about those sessions  This guy was well respected and credentialed  I was a person hanging on by a thread who desperately needed help and because of his ignorance I went another 6 months not seeing any professional whatsoever  I wouldn't have found my way back at all without support people who basically forced me to because they assumed  quite correctly  it's what I would've wanted if I were thinking clearly    I found a better therapist who's actually good at her damn job and things have gotten better  I'm not telling you this as a "go get 'em  champ" sort of thing  Sometimes the system is so prohibitively ineffective that people go years without finding someone who can actually give the help they need    The point is  the failures of the system do not reflect you or your condition  Don't believe anyone who suggests that anything less than complete support and validation from a professional means your situation is not serious  It is  You wouldn't be seeking help and posting on here if it wasn't  The likelihood that the person you've communicated with is kind of shitty at what they do is far greater than your problems being trivial and unimportant   Thank you for taking the step to share your experience here  I'm sorry everything has to be so hard right now   Contact someone higher up  like a manager thats just so true   There are high points and pitfalls when it comes to recovery  It takes a long fucking time  I'm still not even there yet  I was told that things aren't always going to be good  and that's okay  there will be bad days  I'm glad I was told honestly because that makes the really shitty days a bit easier to get through  knowing that it will happen and to not freak out when you aren't happy 100  of the time understand the desire to clear the air   Exchanges like "How are you " "I'm fine  thanks  And you " are just polite talk  which just means it's a social norm established to set another  test  if you will  of your inclusion in the community  You have to know to say the question  and you have to know how to answer  and the exchange tells both of you that you are both part of the same social community via completing these "formalities"   Since it doesn't really mean anything  we spend most of our lives spitting and repeating just as a greeting  not as a real inquiry    But then when someone asks "How are you " and you are NOT fine  the inquiry just draws attention to that fact  Suddenly you are re aware of whatever it is that is making you not fine  and aware that  socially  it's not acceptable to be not fine    I think that's why if feels so bad to tell even that little lie  "How are you " is a matter of inclusion  and when you're not doing so well  you realize how alienated medical hospital due to horrific side effects  or simply does nothing  I really don't feel like I'm a good example of any experience with any drug   That being said  someone else who experiences symptoms of outright psychosis might have had the exact side effects I had and made the decision that they were worth the trade off  That person could decide that not having psychosis is better than always heard that therapy was a place to open up so I made the effort  A critical point in my abuse story hinged on my parents breaking into a locked box in my bedroom while I was out of town and searching through my things  I was 21 at the time   They found out about some fairly innocent sexual interests habits  made an insane logical leap and accused me of being a predatory child molester  I was  and still am  an extremely vocal advocate for victims of child sex abuse and education prevention of CSA  a behavior my parents classified under the vast umbrella of me being "too sensitive"    This was only our second session but I was worried that if I withheld any information in this story that it might leave room for doubt in my version of events and make him think I was hiding the truth that I really did have pedophilic tendencies  So I told him in detail  the incredibly personal  private and totally harmless sexual interests that my parents learned about me   He agreed that my parents' accusations were ridiculous and manipulative  but he became fixated on these very personal things I'd told him  I had always assumed that it's part of being a therapist that even if you're completely shocked by something  you react calmly to it and explore it with your client neutrally  This guy did the exact opposite  He treated the things I had told him  things that are well known and studied in the field of psychology and shared by millions of people around the world  as if he had discovered a strange new form of mental deviation  He was fascinated and made sure the rest of the session revolved around this topic   He reacted like you might react to your best friend saying they were abducted by aliens who speak French  wear lederhosen and exclusively drive 2003 Dodge Durangos  wanting to engage and be supportive but dumbfounded by the ridiculousness of it and unable to keep from being patronizing while discussing it because you can't say "do the aliens choose 2003 Durangos for the features or did they just get a bunch of them randomly " while keeping a straight face  This was the tone of the conversation we had   He asked suppositional questions about it like I was a specimen to dissect  even when I repeatedly tried to change the subject  I felt like he wanted to publish some paper on me entitled "sexual freaks  they walk among us"  He kept making jokes about it  repeatedly stating he likes to use humor to approach awkward subjects  He did say there was nothing wrong with it  as he literally stifled laughter  with the implied air of "some people live in abandoned lighthouses  shampoo their hair with peanut butter and fall in love with paper clips  I'm not gonna tell you to stop being a fucking weirdo"   He connected the fact that I was a 24 year old virgin and hadn't been involved with anyone romantically since I was 16 not to my trauma from abuse  self hatred and crippling anxiety  but rather because I was stuck using my unconventional sexuality as a coping mechanism  and made jokes about how no woman would ever be interested in someone who does these sorts of things  Half jokingly  he advised me to never let anyone I might date know about them    He ended the session by saying that he looked forward to discussing this more  not my abuse trauma or my disastrous executive function or my paralyzing anxiety  but specifically this topic  stating this in a euphemistic way that cracked another joke about it   He said our goal moving forward would be to help me transition from these interests to an "actual girl"  The way he phrased it very strongly implied vaginal intercourse  despite the fact that he knew at the time I was practicing abstinence   Every mental health professional I've ever told this story has been horrified  My current therapist is near impossible to shock  and even she got visibly angry when I recounted it to her  It was one of the most violating experiences of my life  and I'm glad I wrote it out since and financially  It can ruin your relationships and cause you to behave in ways that are completely unlike any way you would behave if you were not manic  You can lose your job  your home and your family while manic  Not a good time  Trust me when I say the lithium is a far less scary monster when you are facing all of that   That being said  there are multiple mood stabilizers  and a bunch more that are used as mood stabilizers that are not specifically rated as such    If you are true to life bipolar  most studies  and most but not all  doctors would suggest that an antidepressant alone is a bad idea  Citalopram  Celexa  is an antidepressant  The reason for the monotherapy being considered a bad idea for bipolar folks is that it has been noted that antidepressants seem to precipitate mania or hypomania in much of that population if some kind of mood stabilizer is not also on board  Some people with bipolar disorder cannot handle antidepressants at all  Everyone's makeup is different though so everyone's doctor has to treat them as an individual   I suggest you discuss your concerns with your doctor  That person is going to be the best person to answer the question for you  From the limited information you gave  I am suspicious that you are not in the right ballpark but I am not a professional and no one should make ANY kind of diagnosis after a paragraph of information   You also should not put a whole lot of stock into much of what I have said since it is based off of the very little you wrote and I am not a professional  I just felt you down   You are only 15  You are a child in the world  What they did was horrible and manipulative   Have you told your parents  Our collective understanding of these conditions is lacking  and misdiagnosis is a thing  At 18  I attempted suicide  I didn't have any of the other symptoms I've experienced in depressive phases  I just thoughtfully evaluated the challenges I was facing  concluded it wasn't worth it  and methodically planned and executed an attempt  There's a long tradition of people committing suicide to escape shame and dishonor  e g  when outed for scandal or crimes  It's a very recent modern take that suicide is a slam dunk indicator of Major Depression  Anyway  I was diagnosed with MD   At 20  I had a manic episode that resulted in total insomnia  I was again diagnosed with MD  because insomnia can be a symptom  At 27  another manic episode with insomnia  Again  MD diagnosis   At 35 I had a manic episode with psychosis  and was finally diagnosed with Bipolar I  which I believe to be the best available diagnosis for me  and which I believe came 15 years late  despite my being entangled with the MH system for much of that time   At 37  I had another manic episode with psychosis  This time I was misdiagnosed with schizophrenia and put on irrelevant meds  As a result  I stayed totally manic for 3 months  and my life was 90  destroyed  I'm told that's really bad for you  Finally  a different doctor intervened and put me back on Lithium  and the mania stopped in a few days   Lithium isn't necessarily terrible  I never had any noticeable side effects from it  As I understand it  it isn't without risks  though   Anyway  I don't really know how one goes about getting the best diagnosis in this kind of system  Unfortunately  "getting the help you need" does not necessarily get you the help you need  But it might be the best you can do  just the same  In my experience  the state didn't matter as long as I had a valid prescription and or refills owed to me   Your Michigan doctor might not be willing to keep prescribing for you without seeing you regularly though  so you might want to look into finding a new doctor in the location that you moved to     Look for a walk in psychiatric clinic near you if one is available and you need a new prescription on short notice   Wellbutrin isn't really considered a dangerous substance so they shouldn't give you much trouble on getting the same dosage  I use this subreddit as a support group  kinda like an AA AlAnon meeting  I do a similar thing on r anxiety   The ability to express my concerns  fears  and hopes to a group of people who understand has helped me so much  People saying 'wow  i know exactly what you're talking about' makes me feel less alone   Seeing people recover gives me hope  Just talking to people that have the ability to comprehend what I feel like is freeing    I agree that its really frustrating when people who have never experienced anything like a just need to get out and enjoy the world " Kay   Nah  they just need to go outside  Fresh air is real antidepressant  First thing to do is pick someone in your life looks like a family member for you  and open up to him her  Explain how you're feeling  how you want to escape  Emphasize you dont expect that person to magically cure you and make everything seem like rainbows and unicorns  Trust me when I say it's always better to open up and speak to someone than try and fix something like depression by yourself    Also go out and exercise  It helps  Just the act of exercising releases dopamine that bugged me or depressed me throughout the day week seem trivial when i work out  Almost like "why the hell did that bother me so much  it was literally nothing to be upset about concerned about" someone  try explaining everything to them  If you have someone who can just be there to talk to  maybe hang out with even if you don't really do anything together  it can make the days seem a lot less bleak  People tend to focus on the bad stuff  the stuff that went wrong    We gloss over good things  like when you ask someone how their day was  They're respond "It was good" and then vent about something that went wrong    Rarely do people go on and on about how good their cup of coffee was this morning  They don't talk about the aroma or how it made them feel  More than likely they'll talk about how they can't get through the day without it  how they NEED it    People complain about flying  The wait  the baggage check  the rude flight attendant  'I had to pay for my food'  going through customs  No one has ever expressed cheer wonder and amazement at flying 30 000 feet in the air while sitting on cushioned seat in a steel tube with 100 other people   A lot of people at work think how they like to do things is the right way to do things  They think they are the best at their job  They become managers and get to flex their dominance over others  Do they praise and encourage new ideas  Rarely  They most often start 'shaping things up'  'cleaning up the clutter'  or 'tightening the purse strings'    We are a society of nit pickers and complainers  We even with my existence isn't social shame  it's the fact that the experience of being me is viscerally painful day to day  Ridding myself of any and all pressure to be "normal" wouldn't change this fact    As it happens I do see it from an evolutionary perspective  and I notice that the puzzle pieces tend to fit together from this view whereas the religious view is a mess   For instance  why are so many people so unhappy  Because survival and reproduction are all that natural selection cares about  and both can be achieved by beings that suffer immensely  There are evolutionary advantages in traits that make you miserable as a byproduct   If you are afraid most of the time  you will avoid many dangers because you are always in a state of anxious defensiveness  If you are sad most of the time  you will be engaged in a desperate search for happiness   you will try novel things  be more creative  mate with more members of the opposite sex because nothing will ever satisfy you   Of course  there are random mutations and other factors and some of us will get an overdose of sadness anxiety traits   to the point that chances for survival and reproduction are drastically reduced   That explains me  Needless to say  I will not be selected  It's perfectly clear  and it's no consolation at all because I will have to endure myself until the end    Yeah  that's the Risperidone  I think a lot of those meds are cumulative  so they build up in your system  but you should be able to wean yourself off them  Are you actually schizophrenic or are you using them for the other side effects help rework some bad habits or bad emotional coping skills  CBT for me is seeing a therapist once a week or so and we go over what I did and what I could have done differently  My therapist teaches me to be a better wife through skills and homework  like reading books or doing activities    DBT is dialectical behavior therapy and is more regulated  I went in a group setting  not sure if you can go individually  I did it in conjunction with my usual therapist but he doesn't do DBT  I loved it  it lasted one semester of school  I went at my university  We learned how to cope with emotional needs  and how to meditate  DBT is helpful if you have problems regulating every day emotions  like anger or fear  I still use many of the skills I learned in DBT today    I suggest finding a good therapist first and getting settled and then finding a group DBT group to see to supplement that    Keep in mind I did these things before my first manic break and did it just to cope with depression and feelings  I'm not sure how it would work on mania  but DBT gave me the ability to properly analyze how I was feeling when I went manic so I knew within two days something was wrong and within a week I was on an antipsychotic and diagnosed bipolar type one  I contribute both my years of therapy and DBT to keep me out of real trouble when I went manic    So  tl dr do both  but find a good therapist first because good things happen when you have a good therapist   Whatever you're going through right now  it will get better in time  Trust me  I've been there  And if you feel like talking  just most of Europe  people generally don't talk to strangers and aren't open with people until they get to know them  But if you get to know them over time and gain trust  you'll have made a friend for life   It's actually a real cultural phenomenon  Called the peach vs coconut   https   hbr org 2014 05 one reason cross cultural small talk is so tricky  Peach cultures  Very friendly and open on the surface  People talk easily to strangers  move to first name basis and open to asking personal questions  But quickly you hit the "pit" where the person will no longer reveal anything more   Coconut cultures  People are more closed off to strangers  they won't talk or ask many personal questions  But when you get to know them better and the relationship and friendship builds they'll become more open and treat you like family   I feel like I'm the latter stuck in a culture that's the former  And because of that  I'm not given a chance to build that relationship and trust  I really do feel an issue  and my resulting self consciousness ruined my sex drive  My OB Gyn said he'd had several patients start having problems after a year or two and decide to get it out    In the last few months "this thing" out of my body  I'm very much a skeptic and had zero qualms with the IUD going into it  I was so excited to get it  actually   but I became so physically and psychologically uncomfortable that I was scouring forum after forum on copper IUD's and found hundreds of women who had bad reactions similar to mine  You might say these were not reliable sources necessarily  but I felt so strongly something was very wrong and they matched up well to my experience  The only scientific study I found was one that found copper levels were too high in women after a year of use  But that was only one small study      then again who will fund further studies on the negative effects of such reliable birth control    I can dig it up if you're curious   Personally I think the recent craze over IUD's isn't representative of the many women whose bodies react poorly to them  I'm not saying don't try it   if costs are low  it's totally worth seeing if it works for you  But I personally wouldn't recommend someone drop  500  1000 on one  And if you're feeling uncomfortable  don't hesitate to remove it  I felt so much better once I did     Edit  I also went from 3 day walk in the park out     1  talk about  it  Either to your wife   or your local neighbourhood counsellor or a local support group  I'm not sure if this exists where you're from   but in Australia we have something called "mens shed"  There are heaps of them in each local area and they are designed to get men together to discuss issues that guys are always told not to because we just need to "man up" and not have feelings  They do hobby work   wood work and local neighbourhood projects     2  move forward  This is the hardest one for me  I get so stuck in a rut thinking about what I wanted to do that I forget that today is tomorrow's yesterday  I try to give myself realistic goals and aim for them   like getting myself back in shape etc   Having a schedule for my spare time has really helped     3  relax  Not the sort of relaxation I thought would help   i e   alcohol or computer games   but real relaxation  I have always been on the move and want to keep busy because I don't want to spend any time with my thoughts  so I find it very hard to relax  I have found a couple of apps that help  The one that had helped me the most  which is also free  is called "Depression CBT Self Help Guide" that I have in my smart phone  I cannot recommend this strongly enough     4  ask if your wife is okay  I'm sure you've done this one before   but if she is suffering depression also she may be feeling exactly the same as you  A couple with depression may seem loveless sometimes   but is more just an issue with internalising    5  get fit  Nothing is better for my mental health than psychical health  I used to be quite fit and 5 years of extremely stressful jobs  those life choices again    saw me get quite unfit  which is where I find myself at present  I have been regularly
